net.sf.sprockets.app.ui

Class BaseNavigationDrawerFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Fragment
      • android.app.ListFragment
        • net.sf.sprockets.app.ui.SprocketsListFragment
          • net.sf.sprockets.app.ui.BaseNavigationDrawerFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentCallbacks, ComponentCallbacks2, View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, ActionModePresenter

    public abstract class BaseNavigationDrawerFragment
extends SprocketsListFragment
    Google Play style (pre-Material Design) navigation drawer. Subclasses should call one of the setItems methods, optionally one of the setSelectedItem methods, and implement one of the onListItemClick methods.

    Sample Implementation

    • Method Detail

      • setItems

        public BaseNavigationDrawerFragment setItems(int arrayResId)
        Use each string from the array as a navigation drawer item.

      • setItems

        public BaseNavigationDrawerFragment setItems(String[] items)
        Use each element as a navigation drawer item.

      • setSelectedItemResId

        public BaseNavigationDrawerFragment setSelectedItemResId(int resId)
        If your items array is composed of references to string resources, you may set the currently selected item by its resource ID.
        Parameters:
        resId - 0 for no selected item

      • setSelectedItemPosition

        public BaseNavigationDrawerFragment setSelectedItemPosition(int position)
        Set the item at the position as the currently selected item.
        Parameters:
        position - -1 for no selected item

      • showSettings

        public BaseNavigationDrawerFragment showSettings(boolean show)
        Show the Settings option at the bottom of the list. This must be called before onViewCreated executes. Default is false.

        Listen for the click event in either of the onListItemClick methods, where View.getId() or resId == R.id.settings.

      • showHelp

        public BaseNavigationDrawerFragment showHelp(boolean show)
        Show the Help option at the bottom of the list. This must be called before onViewCreated executes. Default is false.

        Listen for the click event in either of the onListItemClick methods, where View.getId() or resId == R.id.help.

      • showFeedback

        public BaseNavigationDrawerFragment showFeedback(boolean show)
        Show the Send Feedback option at the bottom of the list. This must be called before onViewCreated executes. Default is false.

        Listen for the click event in either of the onListItemClick methods, where View.getId() or resId == R.id.feedback.

      • showRate

        public BaseNavigationDrawerFragment showRate(boolean show)
        Show the Rate option at the bottom of the list. This must be called before onViewCreated executes. Default is false.

        On click the user will be taken to the app's Google Play page. The Rate option will then no longer display in the list.

        public void onListItemClick(ListView list,
                   View view,
                   int position,
                   long id,
